newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian silver closes up, gold down.
newsitem.headline: Indian silver closes up, gold down.

text.p: Indian silver prices opened higher and extended gains towards close on back of thin supplies and fresh industrial support on Friday, dealers said.
Silver was up 45 rupees per kg on Wednesday. The market was closed on Thursday for Parsi New Year.
"Gold on the other hand opened lower and slid further towards the close as seasonal demand petered out at the higher level," they said.
Price of a gold biscuit (116.50 gramme) settled 150 rupees lower at 60,550 rupees per piece. It was up 100 rupees on Wednesday.
"Gold met with profit-taking by the stockist at higher level on expectation of fresh offerings by the custom deparment," one dealer added.
